010package imagingbook.common.mser.visualize;
011
012import java.awt.Color;
013
014/**
015 * Color definitions used in MSER demo plugins.
016 * @author WB
017 *
018 */
019public class MserColors {
020        
021        public static Color Red = new Color(240,0,0);
022        public static Color Green = new Color(0,185,15);
023        public static Color Blue = new Color(0,60,255);
024        public static Color Magenta = new Color(255,0,200);
025        public static Color Brown = new Color(0xA0, 0x52, 0x2D);
026        public static Color Yellow = new Color(255,200,0);
027        public static Color Orange= new Color(0xffb656);
028        public static Color Cyan= new Color(0x00c6FF);          //11efff
029
030        public static Color[] LevelColors = {Red, Green, Blue, Magenta}; // same as SIFT
031        
032        // https://learnui.design/tools/data-color-picker.html#palette
033        // makePalette(0x2a31fb, 0xcb00d6, 0xff00a7, 0xff0078, 0xff5b4d, 0xff9c27, 0xffd019, 0xfffd49);
034        public static Color[] makePalette(Integer... cols) {
035                Color[] colors = new Color[cols.length];
036                for (int i = 0; i < cols.length; i++) {
037                        colors[i] = new Color(cols[i]);
038                }
039                return colors;
040        }
041        
042        
043
044}
